Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Bump to Java.Interop/master/68473f8" (#1668) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
`generator` refactoring and cleanups.

Add `Java.Interop.MarshalMemberBuilder.GetMarshalMethodName()`.

`jnimarshalmethod-gen.exe` now updates the "original" assembly,
instead of emitting marshal methods into a separate assembly.

Within marshal methods, use a new `JniRuntime.JniValueManager`
temporary. This allows saving ~18944 bytes on `Mono.Android.dll.`

Use `msbuild` by default.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[timing] fix for Debug/Release to get combined into CSV" (#1667) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Context: https://jenkins.mono-project.com/view/Xamarin.Android/job/xamarin-android/plot/Build%20times/

The plots on Jenkins are only displaying times for the `Release`
configuration. Looking into it, the `<ProcessMSBuildTiming />` task
was not using the `AddResults` option, so it was replacing the
contents of the CSV file. MSBuild is invoked twice for `Debug` and
`Release`.

Setting `AddResults` will now append additional columns to the
`TestResult-MSBuild-times.csv` file so we get results for both `Debug`
and `Release` configurations.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Bump to mono/2018-02/93e3dafc" (#1666) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Merged pull request "[CodeBehind] Generate codebehind source in design time build" (#1655) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
IDEs don't build the project until the user tells them to (either to debug or
just build) and thus initially the codebehind sources are not generated. This
causes the lack of intellisense as well as error reports from the IDE about
missing types etc. However, IDE uses a so-called "design-time build" to update
project resources and generate source files related to this task. Layout
codebehind generation should be done at the same time and this patch is an
attempt to make it so by adding the `_IncludeLayoutBindingSources` target
dependency to the `_ManagedUpdateAndroidResgen` target used by
design-time-build.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[Xamarin.Android.Build.Tasks] Fix Broken unit test." (#1663) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Commit 0adf1ae0 had a broken unit test which seemed
to pass in a PR but not in a main build.

This commit reworks that test so it passes.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[WIP] [DO NOT MERGE] CodeBehind backend changes" (#1665) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
TODO:
  * Disable binding generation by default
  * Tests

DONE:
 * Remove ILayoutBindingClient interface

 * Remove modifications to Activity and View

 * Move LayoutBinding.cs out of Mono.Android and copy it to the framework
   directory instead, to be used as a "resource" and copied to the generated
   sources directory when building the application.

 * LayoutBinding.cs is now sourced directly from the framework directory,
   ILayoutBindingClient is no longer used in generated code. Instead, we now have
   two constructors, one taking an Activity and the other a View instance.

 * View finding issues are handled by calling user-provided handlers instead of
   the old On{Layout,Fragment}NotFound Activity member methods.

 * Generated partial class code now includes the generic SetContentView method.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Mono.Debugger hangs Visual Studio 2017 for ~3min on the "Starting Android application" step" (#1664) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1.  Build a Xamarin.Android project
2.  Run a Xamarin.Android project

<!--
If you have a repro project, you may drag & drop the .zip/etc. onto the issue editor to attach it.
-->

### Expected Behavior
The app should be deployed to the device and run.

### Actual Behavior
VS hangs for ~3 min, the a message pops up, saying _Mono Debugging for Visual Studio 4.10.5 likely caused 194 seconds  of unresponsiveness. _ Only after, does the app get deployed.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Linker Error with macOS 10.12 and Xamarin Forms for macOS" (#2651) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description
Receiving the following build error on 10.12 with the latest Stable VS for Mac:

"/Library/Frameworks/Xamarin.Mac.framework/Versions/4.4.1.176/src/Xamarin.Mac/BusinessChat/BCChatButton.g.cs(0,0): Error MM4162: The type 'BusinessChat.BCChatButtonStyle' (used as a parameter in BusinessChat.BCChatButton..ctor) is not available in macOS 10.13.2 (it was introduced in macOS 10.13.4). Please build with a newer macOS SDK (usually done by using the most recent version of Xcode). (MM4162) (OurApp.Xamarin.macOS)"


### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a new Xamarin Forms App on macOS on macOS 10.12 with VS for Mac 7.5
2.  Attempt to build and receive the stack trace above

### Expected Behavior
The app builds and runs as it had before the latest Stable Update

### Actual Behavior
Stack Trace above

### Basic Information
-VS for Mac 7.5 (Stable Channel)
-macOS 10.12 (fully up to date other than not being on 10.13)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Call ChangeVisualState when new states are added" (#2649) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description of Change ###

Previously the setting of the initial VisualState for a VisualElement happened when the VisualStateGroupList was set; however, this means an empty VisualStateGroupList when the list is initially created with the DefaultValueCreator. 

This change adds monitoring to the VisualStateGroupList to allow the VisualElement to update its current state as new states are added, which means that any default states (e.g. "Normal" or "Disabled") are immediately set.

### Bugs Fixed ###

- #2625 

### API Changes ###

None

### Behavioral Changes ###

None

### PR Checklist ###

- [x] Has tests (if omitted, state reason in description)
- [x] Rebased on top of the target branch at time of PR
- [x] Changes adhere to coding standard
- [x] Consolidate commits as makes sense

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "System bmac invocations now require all assemblies to be explicitly passed in" (#3948) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

Try compiling an empty foo.cs referencing System.Drawing.dll from 

```
/Library/Frameworks/Xamarin.Mac.framework/Versions/Current/bin/bmac  --tmpdir=tmp/ --baselib=/Library/Frameworks/Xamarin.Mac.framework/Versions/Current/lib/x86_64/full/Xamarin.Mac.dll -r=/Library/Frameworks/Mono.framework/Versions/Current/lib/mono/4.5-api/System.Drawing.dll -native-exception-marshalling foo.cs --new-style
```

vs

```
/Library/Frameworks/Xamarin.Mac.framework/Versions/Current/bin/bmac  --tmpdir=tmp/ --baselib=/Library/Frameworks/Xamarin.Mac.framework/Versions/Current/lib/x86_64/full/Xamarin.Mac.dll -r=/Library/Frameworks/Mono.framework/Versions/Current/lib/mono/4.5-api/System.Drawing.dll -native-exception-marshalling foo.cs --new-style -r=/Library/Frameworks/Mono.framework/Versions/Current/lib/mono/4.5-api/System.dll -r=/Library/Frameworks/Mono.framework/Versions/Current/lib/mono/4.5-api/mscorlib.dll 
```


### Expected Behavior

Before (likely before https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/commit/1d72f45dfd4f0fff2159762a32e87bc7913dacf7) you could compile without ref'ing all of the assemblies yourself.

### Actual Behavior

You'll get a number of compile errors. 

This code: https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/blob/master/src/btouch.cs#L381

may be wrong and assuming Modern/Full and ignoring System. In general the XM code needs to be  scanned for such errors, and preferably tests written. 

### Environment

Lastest master XM

> VS bug [#612783](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/612783)
